alert.note: Alert for Breckinridge; Butler; Edmonson; Grayson; Hardin; Hart; Larue; Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 1:29AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT/430 AM EDT/ EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, NORTHWEST Kentucky, SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky and south central Kentucky, including the following counties, in NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Breckinridge, Hardin and Larue. In NORTHWEST Kentucky, Ohio. In SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Grayson and Hart. In south central Kentucky, Butler and Edmonson. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT /430 AM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1228 AM CDT /128 AM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Leitchfield, Hartford, Munfordville, Casey, Lee, Beaver Dam, Clarkson, Upton, Caneyville and Fordsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Breckinridge; Butler; Edmonson; Grayson; Hardin; Hart; Larue; Ohio
